com.google.android.libraries.mediaframework.layeredvideo

Class VideoSurfaceLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.libraries.mediaframework.layeredvideo.VideoSurfaceLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Layer

    public class VideoSurfaceLayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Layer
    Creates a view which can render video.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean autoplay
      Whether the video starts playing as soon as the surface is created.
      private LayerManager layerManager
      The LayerManager whcih is responsible for creating this layer's view and adding it to the video player.
      private ExoplayerWrapper.PlaybackListener playbackListener
      When a size change occurs, change the size of the surface view.
      private SurfaceHolder.Callback surfaceHolderCallback
      Bind the surface view to the ExoplayerWrapper and unbind them when the surface view is destroyed.
      private VideoSurfaceView surfaceView
      This is where the video is displayed.
      private FrameLayout view
      This is created by the createView(LayerManager) function.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideoSurfaceLayer

        public VideoSurfaceLayer(boolean autoplay)

    • Method Detail

      • createView

        public FrameLayout createView(LayerManager layerManager)
        Description copied from interface: Layer
        Builds and sets up the view that will be layered onto the video player. The returned view must be a FrameLayout to ensure that the LayerManager can overlay it on top of the other layers.
        Specified by:
        createView in interface Layer
        Parameters:
        layerManager - The LayerManager which will contain this layer.
        Returns:
        The view to be layered onto the video player by the LayerManager

      • onLayerDisplayed

        public void onLayerDisplayed(LayerManager layerManager)
        Description copied from interface: Layer
        Called when a Layer's view has been displayed on the screen. Any additional setup which can only be performed after the layer is displayed should be done here.
        Specified by:
        onLayerDisplayed in interface Layer
        Parameters:
        layerManager - The LayerManager which will contain this layer.

      • moveSurfaceToBackground

        public void moveSurfaceToBackground()
        When mutliple surface layers are used (ex. in the case of ad playback), one layer must be overlaid on top of another. This method sends this player's surface layer to the background so that other surface layers can be overlaid on top of it.

      • moveSurfaceToForeground

        public void moveSurfaceToForeground()
        When mutliple surface layers are used (ex. in the case of ad playback), one layer must be overlaid on top of another. This method sends this player's surface layer to the foreground so that it is overlaid on top of all layers which are in the background.

      • setAutoplay

        public void setAutoplay(boolean autoplay)
        Sets whether the video should start playing as soon as the surface is created.
        Parameters:
        autoplay - If true, the video starts playing as soon as the surface is created. If false, then the video must be started programmatically.

      • release

        public void release()
        When you are finished using this object, call this method.
